ul.li1: 1Listen to me, coastlands,
ul.li2: and listen attentively, peoples from far away!
ul.li1: Yahweh called me from the womb;
ul.li2: from the bodyLiterally “intestines” of my mother he made my name known.
ul.li1: 2And he madeLiterally “put” my mouth like a sharp sword;
ul.li2: he hid me in the shadow of his hand,
ul.li1: and he madeLiterally “put” me like an sharpened arrow;
ul.li2: he hid me in his quiver.
ul.li1: 3And he said to me, “You are my servant,
ul.li2: Israel, in whom I will show my glory.”
ul.li1: 4ButOr “And” I myself said, “I have labored inOr “for” vain;
ul.li2: I have used up my strength for nothing and vanity!
ul.li1: Nevertheless, my justice is with Yahweh,
ul.li2: and my reward is with my God.”
ul.li1: 5And now Yahweh says,
ul.li2: who formed me from the womb as a servant for him,
ul.li1: to bring Jacob back to him,
ul.li2: and that Israel might notThe reading tradition (Qere) has “to him” be gathered,
ul.li1: forOr “and” I am honored in the eyes of Yahweh,
ul.li2: and my God has become my strength.

chapter.p: 6And he says, “It is trivial for you to beLiterally “from being you” a servant for me,

ul.li1: to raise up the tribes of Jacob
ul.li2: and to bring back the preserved of Israel.
ul.li1: I will give you as a light to the nations,
ul.li2: to be my salvation to the end of the earth.”

chapter.p: 7Thus says Yahweh, the redeemer of Israel, his holy one,

ul.li1: to the one who despisesA Dead Sea Scroll reads “is despised with respect to” life,
ul.li2: to the one who abhors the nation,
to the slave of rulers:
ul.li1: “Kings shall see and stand up;
ul.li2: princes, and they shall bow down,
ul.li1: for the sake of Yahweh, who is faithful,
ul.li2: the holy one of Israel, and he has chosen you.”

ul.li1: “I have answered you in a time of favor,
ul.li2: and helped you on a day of salvation,
ul.li1: and watched over you,
ul.li2: and given you as a covenant of the people,
ul.li1: to raise up the land,
ul.li2: to give the desolate hereditary property as an inheritance,
ul.li1: 9saying to the prisoners,Literally “captured ones” “Come out!”
ul.li2: to those who are in darkness, “Show yourselves!”
ul.li1: they shall feed alongLiterally “on” the ways,
ul.li2: and their pasturage shall be on all the barren heights.
ul.li1: 10They shall not be hungry or thirsty,
ul.li2: and heat and sun shall not strike them,
ul.li1: for he who takes pity on them will lead them,
ul.li2: and he will guide them to springs of water.
ul.li1: 11And I will makeLiterally “put” all my mountains like a road,
ul.li2: and my highways shall lead up.Or “be high”
ul.li1: 12Look! These shall come from afar,
ul.li2: And look! These from the north and from the west
and these from the land of Sinim.”
ul.li1: 13Sing for joy, heavens, and rejoice, earth!
ul.li2: Mountains must break forth in rejoicing!
ul.li1: For Yahweh has comforted his people,
ul.li2: and he will take pity on his afflicted ones.

ul.li1: 14ButOr “And” Zion said, “Yahweh has forsaken me,
ul.li2: and the Lord has forgotten me!”
ul.li1: 15Can a woman forget her suckling,
ul.li2: refrain from having compassion on the child of her womb?
ul.li1: Indeed, these may forget,
ul.li2: butOr “and” I, I will not forget you!
ul.li1: 16Look, I have inscribed you on the palms of my hands;
ul.li2: your walls are continually before me.
ul.li1: 17Your children hasten;
ul.li2: your destroyers and those who laid you waste departOr “move away” from you.
ul.li1: 18Lift your eyes up all around and see;
ul.li2: all of them gather; they come to you.
ul.li1: As surely as I live,Literally “Life I”
ul.li2: declaresLiterally “declaration of” Yahweh,
ul.li1: surely you shall put on all of them like an ornament,
ul.li2: and you shall bind them on like a bride.

chapter.p: 19Surely your sites of ruins and desolate places and land of ruins,Hebrew “ruin”

ul.li1: surely now you will be too cramped for yourLiterally “cramped by” inhabitants,Hebrew “inhabitant”
ul.li2: and those who engulfed you will be far away.

chapter.p: 20Yet the children born when you were bereavedLiterally “of your bereavement” will say in your hearing,Literally “ears”

ul.li1: “The place is too cramped for me;
ul.li2: make roomLiterally “approach” for me so that I can dwell.”

chapter.p: 21ThenOr “And” you will say in your heart,

ul.li1: “Who has borne me these?”
ul.li2: And, “I was bereaved and barren,
ul.li1: exiled and thrust away;
ul.li2: soOr “and” who raised these?
ul.li1: Look at me! I was left alone;
ul.li2: where have these come from?”Literally “these where they”

ul.li1: “Look! I will lift my hand up to the nations,
ul.li2: and I will raise my signal to the peoples,
ul.li1: and they shall bring your sons in their bosom,
ul.li2: and your daughters shall be carried on their shoulders.Hebrew “shoulder”
ul.li1: 23And kings shall be your guardians,Literally “those who nurture”
ul.li2: and their queens your nurses.
ul.li1: They shall bow down, facesLiterally “noses” to the ground, to you,
ul.li2: and they will lick up the dust of your feet.
ul.li1: ThenOr “And” you will know that I am Yahweh;
ul.li2: those who await me shall not be ashamed.
ul.li1: 24Can war-booty be taken from the mighty?
ul.li2: or can a captive of a righteousThe Dead Sea Scroll has “violent” person be rescued?

ul.li1: “Indeed a captive of the mighty shall be taken,
ul.li2: and the war-booty of the tyrant shall be rescued,
ul.li1: forOr “and” I myself will dispute with your opponent,
ul.li2: and I myself will save your children.
ul.li1: 26And I will feed your oppressors their own flesh,
ul.li2: and they shall be drunk with their blood as with wine.
ul.li1: ThenOr “And” all flesh shall know that I am Yahweh,
ul.li2: your savior and redeemer, the strong one of Jacob.”
